title: LA’s Railroad Robber Barons
sub_head: Jesse James was born in the wrong century. Today robbing trains is easy.
body:
Wonder what happened to the gift you sent that your sister never received, or the Covid at-home tests you ordered that were never delivered? Maybe they were pillaged by the bandits that rule Los Angeles.
Photos of train tracks in LA littered with ransacked boxes made news over the weekend, but the railroad robberies aren’t new. Union Pacific Railroad says 90 containers on average are getting hit each day. Thieves climb onto the trains when they stop, use bolt cutters to break into containers and help themselves to the goods, discarding what they don’t want or can’t carry.
